cards.title: Console Logging
Numbers & Variables
Strings
cards.code:
let single = "Wheres my bandit hat?";
console.log(single.length); // 21

cards.title: Comments
Assignment Operators
String Interpolation
cards.code:
let age = 7;
`Tommy is ${age} years old.`;

cards.title: let and const
if Statement
Ternary Operator
cards.code:
let x = 1;
const result = x == 1 ? true : false;

cards.title: else if
switch Statement
Comparison & Logical Operators
cards.code:
1 > 3; // false
3 > 1; // true
250 >= 250; // true
1 === 1; // true
1 === "1"; // false

true || false; // true
true && true; // true
!true; // false

cards.title: Nullish Coalescing (??)
cards.code:
null ?? "I win";       // 'I win'
undefined ?? "Me too";  // 'Me too'
false ?? "I lose";      // false
0 ?? "I lose again";    // 0

cards.title: == vs ===
cards.code:
0 == false;        // true
0 === false;       // false
1 == "1";         // true
1 === "1";        // false
null == undefined; // true
null === undefined; // false

cards.title: Function Declaration
Anonymous & Arrow Functions
Concise Arrow Function
cards.code:
const multiply = (a, b) => a * b;
console.log(multiply(2, 30));

cards.title: Function Expressions & Parameters
Block vs Function Scope
Closures in Loops
Array Basics
Array Methods
Set Basics
Loop Types
Loop Helpers
map / filter / reduce
Callback Example
Basic Object Access
cards.code:
const apple = { color: "green" };
apple.color;

cards.title: Methods, this, and Shorthand
Class Basics
extends
cards.code:
class Media {}
class Song extends Media {}

cards.title: ES Modules
cards.code:
export function add() {}
import { add } from './math.js';

cards.title: CommonJS
cards.code:
module.exports = { add }
const math = require('./math.js')

cards.title: Promise Basics
cards.code:
const p = new Promise((res, rej) => {...});
p.then(...).catch(...);
